events.name: Honduras Ends Diplomatic Ties with Taiwan, Recognizes One China Policy
events.wd_label: Honduras Ends Diplomatic Ties with Taiwan, Recognizes One China Policy
events.wd_description: Honduras formally ended its diplomatic ties with Taiwan, recognizing the One China policy and establishing relations with the People's Republic of China, following China's strategy of isolating Taiwan diplomatically.
events.description: Honduras formally ended its diplomatic ties with Taiwan, recognizing the One China policy and establishing relations with the People's Republic of China, following China's strategy of isolating Taiwan diplomatically.

events.name: Honduras' Decision to End Ties with Taiwan
events.wd_label: Honduras' Decision to End Ties with Taiwan
events.wd_description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Honduras announced the formal end of diplomatic ties with Taiwan, recognizing the People's Republic of China as the sole government of China.
events.description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Honduras announced the formal end of diplomatic ties with Taiwan, recognizing the People's Republic of China as the sole government of China.

events.name: China's One China Policy
events.wd_description: By recognizing the One China policy, Honduras aligns with China's stance that Taiwan is part of China, leading to the termination of diplomatic relations with Taiwan.
events.description: By recognizing the One China policy, Honduras aligns with China's stance that Taiwan is part of China, leading to the termination of diplomatic relations with Taiwan.

events.name: Impact on Taiwan
events.wd_description: China's continued efforts to isolate Taiwan diplomatically, including securing Honduras' recognition, add to the mounting pressure on Taiwan under the leadership of Xi Jinping.
events.description: China's continued efforts to isolate Taiwan diplomatically, including securing Honduras' recognition, add to the mounting pressure on Taiwan under the leadership of Xi Jinping.

events.name: Continued Rescue Efforts and Rising Death Toll After Turkiye-Syria Earthquakes
events.wd_label: Continued Rescue Efforts and Rising Death Toll After Turkiye-Syria Earthquakes
events.wd_description: Ten days after multiple earthquakes hit the border of Turkiye and Syria, rescue operations continue, with the death toll reaching 42,000. Poor construction standards are blamed for the high fatalities, and relief efforts are underway.
events.description: Ten days after multiple earthquakes hit the border of Turkiye and Syria, rescue operations continue, with the death toll reaching 42,000. Poor construction standards are blamed for the high fatalities, and relief efforts are underway.

events.name: Ongoing Rescue Operations
events.wd_description: Emergency services continue to rescue survivors from the rubble 10 days after multiple earthquakes struck the Turkiye-Syria border, highlighting the ongoing nature of the disaster.
events.description: Emergency services continue to rescue survivors from the rubble 10 days after multiple earthquakes struck the Turkiye-Syria border, highlighting the ongoing nature of the disaster.

events.name: Rising Death Toll and Blame on Construction Standards
events.wd_label: Rising Death Toll and Blame on Construction Standards
events.wd_description: The death toll from the earthquakes has risen to 42,000, with poor construction standards being blamed for the massive fatalities. Over 100 developers and builders have been arrested in Turkey, but officials who authorized the construction have escaped accountability.
events.description: The death toll from the earthquakes has risen to 42,000, with poor construction standards being blamed for the massive fatalities. Over 100 developers and builders have been arrested in Turkey, but officials who authorized the construction have escaped accountability.

events.name: UN Appeals and International Response
events.wd_description: The UN has launched relief fund appeals for Turkiye ($1 billion) and Syria ($400 million) as more than 1 million people have been displaced, with NATO commenting on the disaster as one of the most devastating on NATO soil.
events.description: The UN has launched relief fund appeals for Turkiye ($1 billion) and Syria ($400 million) as more than 1 million people have been displaced, with NATO commenting on the disaster as one of the most devastating on NATO soil.

events.name: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_label: ICC Issues Arrest Warrant for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issued arrest warrants for Russian President Vladimir Putin and Russian official Maria Lvova-Belova, accusing them of involvement in the deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: ICC Arrest Warrants
events.wd_description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.
events.description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Maria Lvova-Belova, alleging their involvement in a scheme to deport Ukrainian children to Russia.

events.name: Allegations of Child Deportation
events.wd_description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.
events.description: The ICC stated that it has sufficient evidence to believe that Putin and Lvova-Belova were involved in the deportation of Ukrainian children and that Putin failed to exercise control over subordinates who committed these acts.

events.name: Ukraine's Response
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky expressed appreciation for the ICC's decision and noted that Ukrainian investigations suggest direct Kremlin involvement in the forced deportation of children.

events.name: Ford's Commitment to Building NCM and LFP Batteries in the U.S.
events.wd_label: Ford's Commitment to Building NCM and LFP Batteries in the U.S.
events.wd_description: Ford commits to building both nickel cobalt manganese (NCM) and lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries in the U.S., investing $3.5 billion to build an LFP battery plant in Michigan as part of its $50 billion global push to lead the EV revolution, creating 2,500 jobs and aiming to diversify its U.S. supply chain.
events.description: Ford commits to building both nickel cobalt manganese (NCM) and lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries in the U.S., investing $3.5 billion to build an LFP battery plant in Michigan as part of its $50 billion global push to lead the EV revolution, creating 2,500 jobs and aiming to diversify its U.S. supply chain.

events.name: Investment in LFP Plant
events.wd_description: Ford invests $3.5 billion to build the country's first automaker-backed LFP battery plant in Marshall, Michigan, expected to begin production in 2026 with 2,500 employees, adding approximately 35 GWh of LFP battery capacity.
events.description: Ford invests $3.5 billion to build the country's first automaker-backed LFP battery plant in Marshall, Michigan, expected to begin production in 2026 with 2,500 employees, adding approximately 35 GWh of LFP battery capacity.

events.name: Ford+ Plan and EV Goals
events.wd_description: As part of the Ford+ plan, Ford aims to deliver an annual run rate of 600,000 electric vehicles globally by the end of 2023 and 2 million by the end of 2026, making EVs more accessible and affordable for customers.
events.description: As part of the Ford+ plan, Ford aims to deliver an annual run rate of 600,000 electric vehicles globally by the end of 2023 and 2 million by the end of 2026, making EVs more accessible and affordable for customers.

events.name: Impact on Job Creation
events.wd_description: Ford and its battery tech collaborators have announced $17.6 billion in investment in EV and battery production in the U.S. since 2019, leading to over 18,000 direct jobs and more than 100,000 indirect jobs across Michigan, Kentucky, Tennessee, Ohio, and Missouri.
events.description: Ford and its battery tech collaborators have announced $17.6 billion in investment in EV and battery production in the U.S. since 2019, leading to over 18,000 direct jobs and more than 100,000 indirect jobs across Michigan, Kentucky, Tennessee, Ohio, and Missouri.

events.name: Collaboration with CATL
events.wd_description: Ford has reached an agreement with CATL to manufacture LFP battery cells in Michigan using CATL’s battery cell knowledge and services, adding to Ford’s existing battery capacity and technology collaborations.
events.description: Ford has reached an agreement with CATL to manufacture LFP battery cells in Michigan using CATL’s battery cell knowledge and services, adding to Ford’s existing battery capacity and technology collaborations.

events.name: Sustainable EV Supply Chain
events.wd_description: LFP battery technology helps reduce reliance on critical minerals such as nickel and cobalt, aligning with Ford’s commitments to sustainability and human rights, including its goal of achieving carbon neutrality globally by 2050.
events.description: LFP battery technology helps reduce reliance on critical minerals such as nickel and cobalt, aligning with Ford’s commitments to sustainability and human rights, including its goal of achieving carbon neutrality globally by 2050.
